text: A lion pretended to be sick: with this trick he brought all the animals into his cave, and when he had them there he killed them. The fox also came; but, not trusting, she said from outside to the lion that she felt very sick. And the lion saw that he was not coming in, and said, Why come not in? Do you pray for my good fortune when I am so weak that even if I wanted to, I would not be able to hurt you? So go in like the others. "This is what gives me suspicion", replied the fox, "that I see here the footprints of those who have entered, but I do not see those who have gone out. Do not blindly believe what you are told, but judge the words according to the actions of the person who speaks them.
title: El león y la zorra
author: nan Esopo
